text: Moyosola Niran Oladunni (born September 16, 1971) is a Nigerian banker, entrepreneur, and politician. He is the Chief Executive Officer of Integrated Intelligent Imaging West Africa Limited (I-CUBE WA LTD) and was a gubernatorial aspirant under the All Progressives Congress (APC) in the 2016 Ondo State election. == Background == Moyosola was born in Akure, Ondo State, Nigeria. He obtained a bachelor's degree in Philosophy from Ondo State University in 1998 and completed the Senior Management Programme (SMP 30) at Lagos Business School in 2007. == Career == Moyosola in 2007, he became the founding Chief Executive Officer of Integrated Intelligent Imaging West Africa Limited (I-CUBE WA LTD). Under his leadership, I-CUBE WA LTD generated â‚¦1.24 billion in revenue for the Federal Airports Authority of Nigeria (FAAN) within 31 months of managing the access gate at Murtala Muhammed International Airport. In 2016, Moyosola was a gubernatorial aspirant under the All Progressives Congress (APC) in Ondo State. He was also appointed Director of Youths and Mobilization for the Oluwarotimi Akeredolu Campaign Organization during the 2016 governorship election. He is currently the Vice Chairman of Ala Resort Limited, a special purpose vehicle initiated in partnership with Federal Airports Authority of Nigeria to develop the first aerotropolis in Sub-Saharan Africa. ==References== Category:Living people Category:1976 births Category:Nigerian bankers Category:Nigerian businesspeople Category:Nigerian politicians Category:People from Ondo State
title: Moyosola Niran Oladunni
